Some of these art galleries in Bangalore experience footfall of as many (Read More)as 1500 people a day while some others like Venkatappa Art Gallery are among "Must Visit Places of Bangalore". In this collection, we have compiled an elaborate list of the best art galleries in Bangalore, have a look now and head to one right away! Here is the list of 21 Stunning Art Galleries in Bangalore for Art Connoisseurs & Enthusiasts 1. National Gallery Of Modern Art, Bangalore, Bangalore 4.4 /5 Located in the restored heritage Manikyavelu Mansion on 49 Palace Road Bangalore, the National Gallery of Modern Art was inaugurated on the 18th of February, 2009. Housing over 14,000 incredible works of contemporary and modern artists, the top-notch collection includes spectacular paintings and sculptures from Raja Ravi Verma, Jamini Roy, Amrita Sher-Gil, and Rabindranath Tagore. The premises, spread over an area of 3.5 acres boasts lush green gardens with brightly blooming flowers and is a perfect blend of modern architectural designs and the poise of the past. Timings : 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM Closed on Mondays Time Required: 2 - 3 hours Entry Fee : Indians - INR 20Foreigners - INR 500 Read More 2. Venkatappa Art Gallery, Bangalore 3.7 /5 Located in the premises of Karnataka Government Museum, Venkatappa Art Gallery situated on Kasturba Road, Cubbon Park flaunts over 600 paintings. Named after the most famous artist of Bangalore city - K. Venkatappa, the gallery houses resplendent works of the namesake painter and other renowned artists as well. The two-storeyed museum is further divided into different galleries, some of which display antiques from the Indus Valley Civilization, paintings from the Hoysala, Gandhara, and Nolamba periods. Some of the rare artworks displayed date back to 2000 BC. Timings : 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Closed on Mondays Time Required: 1 - 2 hrs Entry Fee : Adults: INR 10,Kids: INR 5 Read More 3. Tasveer Art Gallery, Bangalore Tasveer Art Gallery is situated on Kasturba Cross Road in Bangalore and is considered to be one of the top South Asian galleries. The gallery takes pride in exhibiting the works of budding Indian and international photographers. Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 4. Sublime Galleria, Bangalore Situated in Ashok Nagar in Bangalore, Sublime Galleria is India's first sky gallery. The gallery is perched on the bridge connecting two tall towers in UB City. The gallery displays photography work and digital art. Timings : 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM, Closed on Sunday Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More Bangalore Travel Packages Compare quotes from upto 3 travel agents for free 4 Nights / 5 Days Nature Escape from Bangalore to Chikmagalur Bangalore(1N) → Mysore(1N) → Chikmagalur(2N) ₹12,649/person Get Offers> 3 Nights / 4 Days Best Selling Coorg Holiday Package from Bangalore Bangalore(0N) → Coorg(3N) ₹12,599/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Historical Hampi Tour from Bangalore Bangalore(1N) → Hospet(3N) ₹9,000/person Get Offers> 2 Nights / 3 Days Unforgettable Ooty Honeymoon Package from Bangalore Bangalore(0N) → Ooty(2N) ₹ 9,500 23% off ₹7,300/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Fun Getaway from Bangalore to Mysore and Ooty Bangalore(1N) → Mysore(1N) → Ooty(2N) ₹5,000/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Essence of Karnataka in 5 Days Bangalore(1N) → Mysore(1N) → Coorg(2N) ₹16,649/person Get Offers> View All Packages For Bangalore View All Packages For Bangalore 5. Crimson Art Gallery, Bangalore Crimson Art Gallery is situated on Cunningham Rd, Bengaluru and offers a variety of artwork. The gallery also boasts of some of the celebrated works of M F Hussain and Murali Cheeroth. Timings : 11:00 AM - 7:30 PM, Closed on Sunday Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 6. Mahua Art Gallery, Bangalore Founded in 2002, Mahua Art Gallery is situated in Armane Nagar, Bengaluru. The gallery focuses on displaying the art works of the young and budding artists. Timings : 10:00 AM - 7:00 PM Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Entry Fee : None Read More 7. Gallery Sumukha, Bangalore Situated in Wilson Garden, Bangalore, Sumukha Gallery was founded in 1996 and is popular for its display and exhibitions of contemporary artwork, paintings, and print sculptures. Timings : 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Closed on Sunday Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 8. Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath, Bangalore Located in Sheshadripuram in Bengaluru, Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath is an art gallery comprising of thirteen museum galleries and five exhibition galleries. The place is also home to the College of Fine Arts. Timings : 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 9. Gallery G Gallery G is situated in Ashok Nagar in Bangalore and was founded in 2003. The gallery facilitates Artists Initiative Program and helps curate and evaluate arts. Read More 10. Shanti Road Gallery Shanti Raod Studio Gallery is situated in Shanti Nagar. It is a non-profit gallery which was founded by Suresh Jayaram in 2003. This art gallery in Bangalore also holds workshops and monthly talks. Read More 11. Rangoli - Metro Art Centre, Bangalore Rangoli-Metro Art Centre is situated in Shivaji Nagar in Bangalore. Founded by Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation, the gallery is a unique cultural space which houses 3 art gallery, spaces for cultural art exhibitions, play area for kids and auditorium. Timings : 10:00 AM - 7:30 PM Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 12. Art Cafe, Sheraton Grand Art Cafe is a unique concept with an art gallery around a cafe. Located in the sky bridge at the Brigade Gateway campus, overlooking the lake at Orion Mall, the overall ambience is one of a kind. There are specially curated shows and weekend workshops. 13. Galleryske, Bangalore Situated in Langford town, Shanti Nagar, Bangalore, Galleryske is basically a cottage belonging to 1870 which displays amazing works of artists like Sheela Gowda, Tara Kelton, and Bharti Kher. Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 14. Indian Institute of Cartoonists, Bangalore IIC or Indian Institute of Cartoonists is a non-profit organisation based in Craig Park, Bangalore. The organization was founded in 2001 and strives to preserve and promote cartooning and cartoonists in India. Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 15. Genesis Art Gallery, Bangalore Situated in Jayanagar in Bangalore, Genesis Art Gallery was founded in 2011. Besides the display of craftswork, the gallery also holds talks, workshops and workmanship debates as well. Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 16. Gallery Time and Space Situated in The Guild, Lavelle Road in Bangalore, Gallery Time and Space encourages contemporary artists to display their workmanship. The gallery also hosts several workshops and solo artists talks and gatherings. Read More 17. Renaissance Gallery, Bangalore Situated on the Cunningham Road in Bangalore, Renaissance Gallery, also known as Indian Art Gallery, was established in 1993. The gallery displays work of online arts, fine arts, Indian paintings etc. Time Required : 1 - 2 hrs Read More 18. Kynkyny Art Gallery Kynkyny Art Gallery is situated on Infantry Road in Bangalore, and was founded in 2004. The gallery encourages crosswise display of arts and mingles workmanship of various artists. Read More 19. Abstract Art Gallery Abstract Art Gallery is situated in Cunningham Road and is one of the most popular art galleries in Bangalore. The gallery celebrates contemporary artists which have been made infamous for their sense of art previously. Read More 20. Gallery Manora Gallery Manora is situated in Hoysala Nagar, Indiranagar in Bangalore. The gallery has two sections- one is material textures and the other is earthenware expressions. It is relatively one of the newest art galleries in Bangalore and has facilities like pantry, car parking etc. Read More 21. Life on Wall Life on Wall Art Gallery is one of the liveliest and prettiest art galleries in Bangalore, situated in Whitefield. The exhibited artists promote young and budding artists and their artworks on life and the like. Read More Which of these art galleries in Bangalore has left you speechless? Let us know in the comments below!
